qas.question: When was John Locke's essay written?
What was Edward Pococke the Younger's religion?
What did Ibn Tufail publish in 1671?
What does Hayy ibn Yaqdhan mean?

context: In the <a4_0>12th century CE<a4_0/> the <a3_0><b7_0>Andalusian<b7_0/><a3_0/> <a2_0><b6_0>Muslim<b6_0/><a2_0/> philosopher and novelist <a0_0><a1_0>Abu Bakr Ibn Tufail<a1_0/><a0_0/> (known as "Abubacer" or "Ebn Tophail" in the West) included the theory of tabula rasa as a thought experiment in his Arabic philosophical novel, <b8_0>Hayy ibn Yaqdhan<b8_0/> in which he depicted the development of the mind of a feral child "from a tabula rasa to that of an adult, in complete isolation from society" on a desert island, through experience alone. The Latin translation of his philosophical novel, entitled <b9_0>Philosophus Autodidactus<b9_0/>, published by Edward Pococke the Younger in <b5_0>1671<b5_0/>, had an influence on John Locke's formulation of tabula rasa in An Essay Concerning Human Understanding.
